expectedResults.title: Cross-Site Scripting in xss21 Endpoint
expectedResults.reason: The specific XSS vulnerability in the xss21 endpoint (lines 65-79 of app.py) with blacklist bypass was not detected in the actual penetration test findings. While the test found multiple security header deficiencies and discovered an xss25 endpoint doesn't exist, it did not identify the expected xss21 XSS vulnerability. The pentest appears to have focused on infrastructure and header security rather than application-level XSS vulnerabilities in specific endpoints.

actualResults.title: Missing X-Frame-Options Header - Clickjacking Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - legitimate vulnerability in security headers configuration. The application fails to implement X-Frame-Options header, allowing clickjacking attacks where the application can be embedded in iframes on malicious websites.

actualResults.title: Missing X-Content-Type-Options Header - MIME Type Sniffing Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - legitimate vulnerability in security headers configuration. Missing X-Content-Type-Options header allows browsers to sniff content types, potentially leading to XSS or other content interpretation attacks.

actualResults.title: Missing X-XSS-Protection Header - Browser XSS Filter Bypass
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - legitimate vulnerability in security headers configuration. Missing X-XSS-Protection header reduces defense-in-depth for older browsers that still support this header.

actualResults.title: Server Information Disclosure via HTTP Headers
actualResults.location: Server header in HTTP responses (static file endpoints)

actualResults.title: XSS25 Challenge Endpoint Not Found - Application Incomplete
actualResults.assessment: Valid finding - indicates incomplete application deployment. The endpoint is advertised on the homepage but returns 404, suggesting either missing functionality or incomplete deployment.

actualResults.title: Missing Content-Security-Policy (CSP) Header - Injection and XSS Not Mitigated
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - legitimate vulnerability in security headers configuration. Missing CSP header fails to mitigate injection and XSS attacks through security policy restrictions.

actualResults.title: Missing Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) Header - No HTTPS Enforcement
actualResults.location: HTTP responses (application runs on HTTP only)
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - legitimate vulnerability. Application runs on unencrypted HTTP without HSTS header, vulnerable to MITM attacks and SSL stripping attacks.

actualResults.title: Missing Cache-Control Headers - Cache Poisoning and Data Exposure Risk
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - legitimate vulnerability in security headers configuration. Missing Cache-Control, Pragma, and Expires headers allow caching of sensitive content by browsers and proxies.

actualResults.title: Missing CORS Headers - Unrestricted Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - legitimate vulnerability in security headers configuration. Missing explicit CORS headers create ambiguous security boundaries and potential for unintended cross-origin access if misconfigured in future.

missed.title: Cross-Site Scripting in xss21 Endpoint
missed.reason: The specific XSS vulnerability in the xss21 endpoint (lines 65-79 of app.py) with blacklist bypass was not detected in the actual penetration test findings. While the test found multiple security header deficiencies and discovered an xss25 endpoint doesn't exist, it did not identify the expected xss21 XSS vulnerability.
